html: Even as his people grow ripe for destruction, Jehovah intervenes to deliver those who repent. He appoints his servant—his arm of righteousness —to restore justice in the earth (Isaiah 42:1-4), to deliver the righteous (Isaiah 51:9-11), to put down the wicked (Isaiah 41:2), and to prepare the way for salvation —their Savior (Isaiah 62:11). As the synonymous parallelism of arm and righteousness identifies one with the other, so a “man,” in the fullest sense of the term, is one who “intercedes” or “intervenes” (mapgiya‘) on behalf of others, especially under the terms of the Davidic Covenant (Isaiah 32:1-2).
